parameters module¶

class parameters.Prepare_parameters(path, inputfile)¶

Bases: object

Structure the parameters in a dataframe table, it enherits from ‘Inputable’ class.

Add_IST()¶
Add_IST insert: a float column to the self.inputable dataframe,

It is the initial extensometer value: EXT_IST_0 from the raw data file. It requires the attribute self.inputable to be already filled

Export(Output_file_name)¶

Export based on the given excel writer

Unique_cycle(rlts_Dehnung, rlts_Spannung)¶

Join the reduced signal for strain and stress to get the hysteresis of the reduced data

data_onecyle()¶

Get the target data of one cycle in order to do fitting.

data_reduction(i_cycle)¶

Strat data reduction for a given cycle.

Param

(int) the given cycle

distance(a, b)¶
Returns

euclidean distance between two points

eps_fit()¶

Fitting: finding the optimal algo tolererance to get desired points per cycle for both strain and stress

init_Parameters()¶

Initialize: all parameters

init_Rowdata(ohne_Zyklus=True, ohne_nan=True)¶

Cleaning the row data from missing value.

-Note: cleaning means also removing the first test cycle (=0).

midata_hysteresis(plot=True, save=False)¶

Initialize: the middle hysteresis which is either the 50% cycle in case the the number of cycles till crack initiation is given or the 10% cycle if not.

:param plot (boolean) True-> plot, False-> not plot :para save (boolean) True-> save, False-> not save :return plot if required

outputfile(Output_file_name)¶

:param output file name :return: The output excel file writer

point_line_distance(point, start, end)¶
rdp(points, epsilon)¶

Reduces a signal to a simplified one without losing relevant points, using: The Ramer-Douglas-Peucker algorithm roughly ported from the pseudo-code provided by http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramer-Douglas-Peucker_algorithm

run_reduced_hyst(plot=True)¶
Returns

the reduced data of the hysteresis plot if desired.

stress_strain()¶

Claculating the stress and strain acording to time and cycles.
